intro: Hymenodictyon timoriense, commonly known as the Timor hymenodictyon, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to the island of Timor and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and showy, yellowish-white flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, wind-dispersed seeds. Hymenodictyon timoriense is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and restricted geographic distribution.
